promptText:
Here is the resume converted into plain text:

Jin Hong Kuan (612) 860 8454
https://jinhongkuan.github.io/portfolio/ kuan0019@umn.edu
Languages: Solidity Python Javascript C++ Rust
Technologies: React (Native & js) web3.js TensorFlow

Education
B.S. Computer Science (Honors), Math Minor, University of Minnesota – Twin Cities
Technical GPA: 3.96/4.00 | Expected Graduation: May 2022
Activities: UMN Blockchain Club (Founder and President) | Award: Dean's List

Experience
Undergraduate Researcher July 2021 – Sept 2021
Santa Fe Institute, NM (Remote)

Summer REU in Complexity Science. Applied ML (Tensorflow) to infer the stochastic dynamics guiding the development of human societies based on the Seshat Databank.
Mentored by Dr. David Wolpert and Dr. Hajime Shimao.
Summer Software Engineering Intern June 2020 – Sept 2020
Collins Aerospace, IA (Remote)

Developed testing software for Avionics equipments, in C, Python and Ansible.
Collaborated with DevOps team through daily remote meetings under Agile framework.
Projects
OpenLabs Aug 2021

HackFS entry. DAO-based platform for scholarly research, utilizing decentralized file storage and token rewards to promote open science.
Ceramic, Chainlink and Protocol Labs pool prize winner. [site | github]
Keylinq June 2021

Decentralized finance (DeFi) application enabling safe payments for freelancers using smart contracts. Live on Binance Smart Chain.
Personal project. Full-stack development with Solidity, web3.js, ReactJs, and IPFS. [site | github]
MinneMUDAC Nov 2019

Student data science challenge. Performed multivariate timeseries forecasting using recurrent neural nets on Tensorflow to predict soybean prices.
Teaching
Department of Computer Science and Engineering, University of Minnesota, MN Jan 2020 – May 2020

CSCI 1113: Introduction to C/C++ Programming for Scientists and Engineers
CSCI 1115: Companion Course for CSCI 1113
Publication
Emergence and Stability of Self-Evolved Cooperative Strategies using Stochastic Machine
Jin Hong Kuan, Aadesh Salecha
IEEE Symposium Series on Computational Intelligence, 2020 [paper | github | slides]

Source Separation and Depthwise Separable Convolutions for Computer Audition
Gabriel Mersy, Jin Hong Kuan

AAAI Conference on Artificial Intelligence, 2021 Student Abstract and Poster Program [paper]

An Empirical Study of Communication-Free Coordination in Human-Robot Teams Through a Coverage Control Game
Jin Hong Kuan, A. Yasin Yazıcıoğlu, Derya Aksaray
University of Minnesota Undergraduate Research Opportunity Program [paper | github]
